channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Duolingo Scores Are Coming to LinkedIn. It Could Change Hiring Forever
item.description: The language learning app Duolingo has partnered with LinkedIn so users can showcase their real-time scores to peers and recruiters.

item.title: Robert Redford, Oscar-winning actor and director, dies at 89
item.description: Robert Redford , the Hollywood golden boy who became an Oscar-winning director, liberal activist and godfather for independent cinema under the name o...

item.title: Markets rally as the Fed meets to decide on what could be 2025’s first interest rate cut
item.description: An “everything rally” in markets greets the start of a two-day Federal Reserve meeting , with stocks at record highs, bond yields subsiding and a two-...

item.title: Facebook, TikTok and even LinkedIn are censoring abortion content even when it’s just medical information, rights groups say
item.description: Electronic Frontier Foundation has collected close to 100 examples of content takedowns submitted by social media users that don't violate any policy.

item.title: Move over meditation—Calm’s new app wants to help improve bedtime all day
item.description: Meditation app maker Calm is no stranger to helping people sleep—users have played its bedtime stories more than 1 billion times in the decade they’ve...

item.title: Customer Churn Is a Company-Wide Problem. Here’s How to Address It
item.description: Customer churn is not, and never was, solely a CS problem. It’s a fundamental company problem.

item.title: Luigi Mangione, alleged killer of UnitedHealth Group CEO, is back in court
item.description: Luigi Mangione is due to appear on Tuesday in New York state court, where a judge may rule on the 27-year-old’s bid to dismiss one of the two indictme...

item.title: Robert Redford, the Sundance Kid turned Sundance mogul, entrepreneur and independent film champion, dies at 89
item.description: He bought two acres in Provo Canyon, Utah, after falling in love with the area on a 1961 motorcycle trip. It was the start of something big.

item.title: Luigi Mangione returns to court after 7 months, with a cult following watching him closely
item.description: Supporters of the 27-year-old Ivy League graduate often wear the Luigi video game character’s green color.

item.title: Robert Redford, Sundance Founder and Oscar-Winning Actor, Dies at 89
item.description: Redford became a patriarch of the independent film movement in the 1980s through his Sundance Institute and film festival.

item.title: Trump launches $15 billion lawsuit against ‘The New York Times’
item.description: President Donald Trump filed a $15 billion defamation lawsuit against The New York Times and four of its journalists on Monday, according to court doc...

item.title: Why Being More Human Is Your Brand’s Biggest Asset in 2025 and Beyond
item.description: In a time of major technological developments, there’s a real benefit to maintaining a more personal connection with customers.

item.title: 5 Rules to Prevent Bots and Assistants From Hurting Your Business
item.description: As more people use AI tools and hire human help to outsource parts of their lives, make sure that assistance doesn’t involve sensitive company informa...

item.description: “It’s critical to communicate in the language and on the platforms where voters spend their time and get their information,” Xavier Becerra said in a ...

item.title: ‘We might be in a K-shaped recovery, but consumer spending is booming’: Healthy retail sales stave off recession fears
item.description: Two straight months of spending declines in April and May had concerned market watchers.
